laboratory_examinations.findings: Located in the region of the descending colon, there is extensive fat stranding and fluid surrounding a focal segment of colon with associated wall edema and diverticula noted. Other than dependent atelectasis, the lung bases are clear without consolidations, pleural effusions, or pulmonary nodules. The liver, gallbladder, spleen, both adrenal glands, both kidneys are unremarkable except for a subcentimeter hypodense lesion on the interpolar region on the right. No intra-abdominal free air or mesenteric/retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy. There is a small amount of pelvic free fluid noted.
